definition: (old) musicians at a wedding cortege or funeral procession/(fig.) trumpeter of sb's praises/booster
to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
old variant of 鼓[gu3]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: However, as a trumpeter father and son are taken care of, he has to wake up.
sentences.chinese: 不过经吹鼓手父子的悉心照料，他已经醒过来。

sentences.english: Trumper played the carols, again and again, the sound deafening noise.
sentences.chinese: 吹鼓手高奏颂歌，一遍又一遍，喧声震天。

sentences.english: Later Christian tradition made him the trumpeter of the Last Judgment.
sentences.chinese: 后来的基督教传统，使他成为吹鼓手的最后判断。

sentences.english: Black German Double Crested Trumpeter to his Black Priest Program.
sentences.chinese: 德国双黑冠吹鼓手他的黑人牧师计划。

definition: suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
to perform music/to play a tune
gongs and drums/Chinese percussion instruments
to attend a funeral/to take part in a funeral procession
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth
pole carrier/coffin-bearer
attendant of the bride or bridegroom at a wedding
to perform in opera
to participate in funeral procession/to attend a burial
to hold a funeral procession
porter for a palanquin
to carry sb in a sedan chair/flatter/sing praises
to weep before a coffin or a memorial to the dead
a bowed stringed instrument with a thin wooden soundboard
clapper-board
